item.title: This sucks: you'll have to pay for two clans in Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2
item.content:encoded:
As Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 finally gets a release date it looks like it will hit - 21st October 2025 - so comes news you'll have to pay to access two of the six clans in the game. Clans here act like your character class, determining what kind of gameplay role your character will adopt, as well as giving you a sense of storied belonging in the world, so they're no trivial thing. And they're not cheap.

In order to access the Lasombra and Toreador clans, you'll need to buy the Shadows and Silk add-on pack, which costs £18.69/€21.99/$21.99. And as far as I can tell, you won't be able to access these locked clans otherwise. If you don't pay, you'll only be able to access the default four: Brujah, Tremere, Banu Haqim and Ventrue.

There's a further gameplay consideration here. Clans modify the difficulty of the game by making you better or worse at certain things. In the preview build of Bloodlines 2 I've just been playing, I picked to be Brujah, which are a brawler-focused group. They are a normal difficulty clan to play as, whereas Ventrue - a clan that dominates minds - are easier, and the Banu Haqim, which revolve around stealthy ambush gameplay, are hard. There's more detail on the various clans on the Bloodlines 2 website, but there's not, frustratingly, any more information on Toreador or Lasombra.

However, Vampire: The Masquerade being a long-standing tabletop role-playing game means there's plenty of available information out there about these locked clans. The Lasombra clan is a shadowy organisation that manipulates through religion, apparently, whereas the Toreador are known for being seductive and enthralling, which is exactly the kind of vampire I'd like to be. It's a shame to have to pay for the privilege.

The Shadows and Silk add-on pack comes as part of the Premium Edition of the game, if you're willing to fork out £74.99/€89.99/$89.99 for it. It also contains the cosmetic Santa Monica Memories pack. But at the moment I suggest you wait. And I say that because I remain unconvinced after a few hours of play.

This game has had a troubled development and it seems to me that in an effort to get it out, the developer has narrowed the scope and focused more on action gameplay rather than an intricate role-playing experience. That's not necessarily a bad thing - there's a terrific sense of speed and punch in what I played - but it does lack substance. I would wait for 21st October and see.

item.title: After all these years, Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 gets an actual proper release date
item.content:encoded:
The long-awaited and much-troubled Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 will finally be released on 21st October 2025, Paradox has announced. It's coming to PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series S/X simultaneously.

There will be standard, Deluxe and Premium editions of the game, the latter two coming with additional content packs. The Deluxe Edition comes with a Santa Monica Memories cosmetic pack, which features cosmetics inspired by the original Bloodlines 1 game from 2004, and the Premium Edition includes that as well as the Shadows and Silk add-on that lets players to choose two additional clans to play as in the game - Toreador and Lasombra.

Alone, the Santa Monica Memories pack costs £9.99/€11.99/$11.99, and the Shadows and Silk pack costs £18.69/€21.99/$21.99.

Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 was originally announced in 2019 and was in development at Hardsuit Labs, and had a prospective release date of 2020. But delays, firings, and development suspensions saw the game moved to The Chinese Room where it has been reshaped and finished for release. Be sure to check out our just-published preview of Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 to see if it has been worth the wait.

item.title: Zero Parades is the next game by Disco Elysium dev ZA/UM, revealed at Gamescom Opening Night Live
item.content:encoded:
Zero Parades has been announced, the next game by ZA/UM. That studio has undergone a drastic amount of staffing changes over the years, but it's the development studio that created Disco Elysium.

Described as an espionage RPG, you play as Hershel Wilk - or CASCADE - on a mysterious assignment. You'll need to make acquaintances of various people at the end of history, each with their own agendas.

On the Zero Parades' official Steam page it's stated the game features a story of "failing forward", and "richly drawn characters". There's no release date for Zero Parades as of yet, but it's clear the game is trying to tap into that same distinct Disco Elysium style, even with many of the senior developers behind that award-winning game absent from the studio.

You can wishlist Zero Parades now on Steam.

item.title: Fallout season two gets a release date and a brand-new trailer featuring a New Vegas favourite
item.content:encoded:
Say hello to Justin Theroux.

After a whole lot of waiting, the second season of Amazon Prime's acclaimed live-action Fallout adaptation finally has an air date. It hits the streaming service on 17th December, and the news is accompanied by a brand-new trailer offering some glimpses of what's in store, including a very familiar moustache.

Fallout Season 2, as we've long known, shifts the action to the post-apocalyptic remains of Las Vegas - as, of course, seen in fan-favourite game entry Fallout: New Vegas - and judging by its latest trailer, there'll be more plenty switching between the past and present.

Returning cast members including Ella Purnell, Walton Goggins, Aaron Moten, and Kyle MachLachlan. And joining them in season two is the always welcome Justin Theroux, who is stepping into the role of Fallout: New Vegas' enigmatic (and elegantly moustached) ruler Robert House - a character who very briefly appeared in season one, albeit played by a different actor.

Earlier this year, Goggins promised Fallout's second season would 'blow [the first] out of the water', and we'll finally being able to judge for ourselves when it begins airing on Amazon Prime from 17th December.
